questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on "The Celebration of Pahela Baishakh in Bangladesh". (within 200 words)

sub_questions.explanation:
The Celebration of Pahela Baishakh in Bangladesh
Pahela Baishakh, the first day of the Bengali New Year, is one of the most colorful and joyous festivals celebrated across Bangladesh. It falls on the 14th of April and is a symbol of the country’s rich culture and heritage. People from all walks of life, regardless of age, religion, or background, come together to celebrate this day with great enthusiasm. The day usually begins with the traditional song “Esho He Baishakh” , sung at dawn under the open sky, especially at Ramna Batamul in Dhaka. People wear traditional clothes—men in panjabi and women in white sarees with red borders.
Colorful processions, known as Mangal Shobhajatra , are brought out in many towns and cities, promoting peace and unity. Traditional foods like panta ilish (fermented rice with hilsa fish) are enjoyed with friends and family. Fairs, cultural programs, music, and dance are common throughout the day. Shops often open a Haal Khata (new account book) and offer sweets to customers.
Pahela Baishakh is not just a festival—it is a reflection of Bengali identity and a time to forget past sorrows and welcome the new year with hope and happiness. It promotes harmony, tradition, and the spirit of togetherness in the nation.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph describing "Uses and Abuses of Social Media". (use 200 words)

sub_questions.explanation:
Uses and Abuses of Social Media
Social media has become a powerful tool in modern society, offering numerous benefits that have transformed communication and information sharing. One of the primary uses of social media is connecting people across the world, allowing friends and family to stay in touch regardless of distance. It also serves as a platform for sharing knowledge, news, and educational content, making learning more accessible. Businesses use social media for marketing, reaching customers, and building their brands. Additionally, social media helps raise awareness about social, political, and environmental issues, encouraging public participation and activism.
However, social media also has its abuses. Excessive use can lead to addiction, negatively affecting mental health and productivity. Many people face cyberbullying, harassment, and privacy violations on these platforms. The spread of misinformation and fake news is a serious problem that can cause confusion and panic. People often compare themselves to unrealistic portrayals of others’ lives, leading to low self-esteem and anxiety. Moreover, social media can distract individuals from real-life relationships and responsibilities, reducing face-to-face interactions.
In conclusion, while social media offers many advantages, it must be used responsibly. Awareness, self-discipline, and digital literacy are essential to minimize its abuses and maximize its benefits for society.
